extensions.heading: {{extensions}}
extensions.description: Extensions provide custom features for use in integrations. Find out more at {{shared.project.name}} Help
extensions.import-extension-dnd-instructions: Drag and drop your extension file here or
extensions.import-extension-generic-error: This is not a valid file type. Try again and specify a .jar file.
extensions.import-extension-help: To update an extension, click Extensions in the breadcrumbs above, and in the list of extensions, click Update for the appropriate extension.
extensions.import-extension-update-help: To update an extension, you must ensure that the new version you are uploading is compatible with the previously uploaded version.
extensions.not-used-msg: No integrations are using this extension.
extensions.delete-extension-modal: Each integration that is listed below uses at least one step that is defined in this extension. If you delete this extension, the consequences are unpredictable.
extensions.delete-extension-modal-error-message: The extension "{{0}}" could not be deleted due to: {{1}}
extensions.delete-extension-modal-lead: Are you sure you want to delete the "{{0}}" extension?
extensions.delete-extension-not-allowed: Unable to delete this extension as it is being used by one or more integrations

api-client-connectors.authorization-endpoint-invalid: Authorization URL is required and must be in a valid format
api-client-connectors.token-endpoint-invalid: Access Token URL is required and must be in a valid format.
api-client-connectors.delete-connector-modal: Deleting a connector deletes all connections that were created from that connector but does not affect a running integration that uses one of those connections.
api-client-connectors.delete-connector-modal-lead: Are you sure you want to delete the "{{0}}" connector?
api-client-connectors.editor-back-button-tooltip: Go back to Review/Edit API Definition step
api-client-connectors.editor-save-button-tooltip: Save changes and return to Review/Edit API Definition step

api-client-connectors.cancel-connector-modal-lead: Do you really want to cancel?

api-client-connectors.edit-tooltip: {{project.name}} cannot make this content available for review/edit. If you want to review or edit the API before {{project.name}} creates the connector, try manually downloading the content and then upload that file.
api-client-connectors.api-review-validation-fallback: No connector details are currently available.
api-client-connectors.api-upload-choose-method: Choose how you want to create your connector:
api-client-connectors.url-upload-instructions: Upload the OpenAPI 2.0 document for your custom API client connector. Custom APIs are RESTful APIs and can be hosted anywhere, as long as a well-documented API is available and conforms to the OpenAPI specification.
api-client-connectors.api-upload-invalid-file: '{{0}}' is not a valid file. Only files that end in '.json', '.yaml', or '.yml' can be uploaded.
api-client-connectors.url-validation-error: You must enter a valid URL before submitting the form.

integrations.leave-editor-message-noname: Are you sure you want to exit editing the integration?

cicd-modal.title: Mark Integration for Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment
cicd-modal.body: Tag this integration for release in one or more of the following environments.
cicd-modal.placeholder: Enter a new environment name here...

import-export.choose-files: Choose one or more zip files that contain exported integrations that you want to import.
import-export.drag-and-drop: Drag and drop your integration files here or
import-export.help-block: Note: The imported integration will be in the draft state. If you previously imported and this environment has a draft version of the integration, then that draft is lost.

describe-data.select-type: Indicate how you are specifying the data type.
describe-data.definition: Paste or write content for the type you selected, for example, for JSON Schema, paste the content of a document whose media type is application/schema+json.
describe-data.name: Enter a name that you choose. This name will appear in the data mapper.
describe-data.description: Enter any information about this data type that might be helpful to you.

edit.delete-step-modal: Are you sure you want to delete this step from the integration?
